Regulation Name(s): Multipurpose system for in vitro coagulation studies
Analyte(s): Coagulation properties via intrinsic and extrinsic pathways
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for ROTEM sigma Thromboelastometry System, a fully integrated and automated in vitro diagnostic instrument for coagulation monitoring in adult whole blood samples.
Indications for Use Summary: Designed to monitor and analyze adult patient coagulation status by measuring viscoelastic properties of citrated venous or arterial whole blood; used to assess peri-operative hemorrhage and/or thrombosis in cardiovascular surgery and liver transplantation in laboratory and point-of-care settings.
